commitMessage:
fix: detect shipped features correctly in HODGE.md status (HODGE-311)

## What Changed
- **Core Detection Logic** (src/lib/hodge-md-generator.ts: 9 lines added)
  - Added ship-record.json check in getCurrentMode() before ship directory check
  - Returns "shipped" status when ship-record.json exists
  - Added "shipped" case to getNextSteps() switch statement
  - Next steps message: "Feature completed. Start new work with `hodge explore <feature>`"

- **Test Coverage** (src/lib/hodge-md-generator.test.ts: 42 lines added)
  - Added 2 smoke tests for shipped mode detection
  - Test 1: Verifies "shipped" status when ship-record.json exists
  - Test 2: Verifies "ship" status when ship directory exists but no ship-record.json
  - Both tests use mocked filesystem for fast execution

- **Project Metadata** (7 files updated)
  - Recorded 4 implementation decisions for HODGE-311
  - Updated id-mappings.json with HODGE-311 PM tracking
  - Created feature tracking in .hodge/features/HODGE-311/

## Why This Change
The /hodge command was showing HODGE-307 and HODGE-308 as "Mode: ship" even though 
they had been successfully shipped hours ago (confirmed by git commits and 
ship-record.json files). 

Root cause: getCurrentMode() only checked if the ship/ directory existed, without
verifying if shipping had completed. This created confusion about which features 
were actively being shipped vs. already completed.
